product_name: Heritage StoreRosewater & Glycerin Hydrating Facial Mist
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGet glowing. Hydrate and refresh for the dewy skin you've been searching for with Heritage Store Rosewater & Glycerin Hydrating Facial Mist.
details: DetailsBenefitsInstantly increases skin's hydration by over 200% after one use**Based on instrumental clinical testing of 30 participantsHydrates and refreshes for dewy, radiant skinKey IngredientsDamask Rose soothes and softens skinGlycerin locks in moisture and helps set makeupSignature Vor-Mag Water - water which has been vortexed and magnetized to promote higher vibrations and energyDermatologically Tested & HypoallergenicFormulated WithoutDyes, alcohol*, parabens, sulfates or phthalates. * Guaranteed to contain less than 20ppm of ethanol.Item 2576132How To UseSpray liberally on skin after cleansing or after makeup to lock in your look.IngredientsWater*, Glycerin, Natural Rosa Damascena Flower Extract Fragrance.*Water (Vor-Mag) has been vortexed and magnetized to raise the energy to a higher vibration.
how_to_use: Spray liberally on skin after cleansing or after makeup to lock in your look.
ingredients: Natural Rosa Damascena Flower Extract Fragrance.*Water (Vor-Mag) has been vortexed and magnetized to raise the energy to a higher vibration

reviews.headline: A beloved product
reviews.comments: I grew up watching my mom use heritage store rosewater and I picked up tge habit too. This product is the holy grail. I have no complaints. It smells wonderful. Works beautifully. If I do nothing else I'll still use this product.

reviews.headline: New Staple
reviews.comments: Just the kind of spray I've been looking for! It leaves my skin looking & feeling plump. New staple for with or without makeup!

reviews.headline: very hydrating
reviews.comments: this is my first time trying this and I did some research before hand and read reviews and decided on this while I was on a wknd beach trip. I used this after a night out. For me, after cleansing and spraying on as a layering before a gel cream. this made my makeup routine beautiful for another night out.

reviews.headline: Disappointing formula change
reviews.comments: The recent formula switch from "rose oil" to "rose fragrance" is so disappointing! Has completely changed the consistency and smell. Feels like a money grab, will sadly have to be looking elsewhere for my rosewater needs.

reviews.headline: Rosewater?
reviews.comments: This was NEVER real rosewater. You don't make rosewater by combining water with rose essential oil, anyone can do that. Rosewater is created by distilling the plant. Yes, the formula has changed because it says rose fragrance instead of rose oil, but either way the product has never been authentic. You can buy some rose oil (which is also fragrance btw) and make some yourself if you prefer the old version. I'm giving it two stars because of the fine mist bottle

reviews.headline: Heritage Store Rosewater
reviews.comments: I go through bottles of these. Love how refreshing it makes my face feel !!! Let it completely dry. I have combination skin and I apply this before and after all my skincare products ! Ive never had an issue with it reacting to my skin . Sometimes I also use it to refresh my makeup but use very little to avoid any separating. My face feels hydrated, fresh , and clean. Definitely worth it !!

reviews.headline: My favorite facial mist
reviews.comments: I have been using this facial mist for years and even if i take a break from using it, i always come back to it. You cannot beat the price for how much product you get. My skin gets very dehydrated and tight throughout the day, so the glycerin & rose water combo always feels so refreshing and really locks in hydration. Ive seen some reviews about reformulation. I just ordered another bottle, so ill see if i still love this product as much as i always have.

reviews.headline: My favorite facial mist
reviews.comments: I have been using this facial mist for years and even if i take a break from using it, i always come back to it. You cannot beat the price for how much product you get. My skin gets very dehydrated and tight throughout the day, so the glycerin & rose water combo always feels so refreshing and really locks in hydration. Ive seen some reviews about reformulation. I just ordered another bottle, so ill see if i still love this product as much as i always have.

reviews.headline: BAD REFORMULATION
reviews.comments: This has been my go to product and first step of my skincare for a while now. Went to go purchase a new bottle and realized the ingredients have changed! Previous formula was a true rosewater with rose oil in it. New formula only has rose fragrance!!! Don't waste your money and get this as it's basically just scented water now and is a break out waiting to happenâ€¦. Such a shame when companies take a good product and ruin it to better their profit margins.

reviews.headline: Doesn't Irritate My Skin
reviews.comments: I was a bit worried about the addition of glycerin to this product since I have used the original and really enjoy it for not only my face, but body and hair also. This glycerin addition hasn't irritated my face or left my hair or body sticky. It does seem to help keep   hair and body hydrated. I do enjoy the scent of roses and I personally find this is low loft scent so the scent is not a problem for me.

reviews.headline: Not even Rosewater
reviews.comments: This is not legit rosewater, look ar fhe ingredients and its just water with rose fragrance. I get that the price may be too cheap for actual rosewater but then it should be marketed as such, because this broke me out horribly. Its also way more sticky than it is moisturizing.

reviews.headline: my favorite rose spray out there!
reviews.comments: I wear this every day on my skin and to set my makeup

reviews.headline: Feels like bad setting spray
reviews.comments: When this dries down, it leaves your skin feeling tight and dry. It feels simalar to a bad setting spray. Not hydrating.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Perfect to use on my sensitive skin all year round but especially during winter! I will continue to repurchase

reviews.headline: NOT PURE ROSEWATER
reviews.comments: I made the crucial mistake by not reading the ingredients. The advertisement is misleading making you think this is pure rosewater. This isn't nothing but water and rose fragance, so if you are searching for the benefits of rosewater this won't do it for you.

reviews.headline: LOVE !!
reviews.comments: makes my skin so glowy omggg

reviews.headline: Yes
reviews.comments: I would like to buy because I like it it change my face dryness.

reviews.headline: using for almost 3 years now!
reviews.comments: I have been using this facial mist for a long time now and repurchased many times. At first I tried the one without Glycerin which I wasn't very impressed with because it would just dry off after a few seconds and make barely any difference. But I really loved the refreshing smell of the Rose, so I decided to try the one with Glycerin and really liked it. Now, I know that this product has mixed reviews, which is understandable because we all need to know that everyone's skin is different. This mist makes my skin very soft, a little bit sticky but I don't mind because I use it before applying Hyaluronic acid serum. They go very well together!

reviews.headline: Smells nice, but..
reviews.comments:
Smells nice, like beautiful roses. However...
I used this on my face, a total of 3 or 4 times. I  broke out after each use. I believe it's the glycerin in it, that my facial skin doesn't like. 
Be that as it may, I took the sprayer off and swapped ot out with a regular top and use it on my skin right after showering. The result is hydrated, fresh dewy skin that has a subtle hint of fresh roses.
TLDR: Bad for MY face, good for body.

reviews.headline: Will always repurchase!
reviews.comments: My mom recommended this to me 3 years ago! I've been using this everday for 3 years! I have very dry skin and this product really helps.

properties.name: Best Uses

values.label: Under makeup or to hydrate dry skin

display_values: Under makeup or to hydrate dry skin

faceoff_positive.comments:
I grew up with knowing my grandmother swore by glycerin, lemon, and rosewater on her skin right into old age, and despite many physical ailments now, you can still see the results of her skin withstanding the test of time. 
While making this at home in small batches ends up creating a mixture much too greasy for me, I love glycerin and rosewater in my skincare. I needed to get my fussy partner into skincare because it drives me crazy watching his lovely deep skin get abused by his pimple popping hobby.
I already have the "lemon" part covered with having him use vit C with Sunscreen daily, but I just could not scout out a rosewater based spray that wasn't just a cocktail of essential oils or the rose is so diminished you don't even get the real fragrance. 
I then stumbled on this after trying several face sprays - either he was complaining they were smelly or I was displeased with the lack of hydration from the fake rose concoctions. This is PERFECT. 3 ingredients, the real smell, beautiful hydration - this is the real deal. Since this is just the real ingredients and nothing more, this is perfect for any skin type as long as you are making sure your skin is responding well to everything else you give it. I have dry skin, partner has oily skin and we love it equally. I will absolutely be stealing this too and a fusspot pimple popper is now happily spraying his face and enjoying real rosewater.
faceoff_positive.headline: Perfect skin health gold simplicity I was on the hunt for

faceoff_negative.comments: This was NEVER real rosewater. You don't make rosewater by combining water with rose essential oil, anyone can do that. Rosewater is created by distilling the plant. Yes, the formula has changed because it says rose fragrance instead of rose oil, but either way the product has never been authentic. You can buy some rose oil (which is also fragrance btw) and make some yourself if you prefer the old version. I'm giving it two stars because of the fine mist bottle
